ya I think that's fine to do, clang is warning us there is an overloaded function `Base::Update` with no args and `Entity::Update` with one arg.

ya I think that's fine to do, clang is warning us there is an overloaded function Base::Update with no args and Entity::Update with one arg.

I'll do the minimal change and just switch to using Entity::Update. Changes worked locally. I'll queue another build

content.raw: mm maybe I misunderstood something but `dataPtr` is declared `private` so that shouldn't affect `Base` or `ODELink` right? Upstream and downstream classes can also have their own private `dataPtr` member variable and they shouldn't conflict with each other?
content.html: mm maybe I misunderstood something but dataPtr is declared private so that shouldn't affect Base or ODELink right? Upstream and downstream classes can also have their own private dataPtr member variable and they shouldn't conflict with each other?

pull_request.title: Pimpl'ize physics Light and Link class

pullrequest.title: Pimpl'ize physics Light and Link class

content.raw: Just pointing out that this class is derived from `Entity` (as is `Link`), and with each class definition, there is potentially the need for distinct private data pointers with distinct names. These classes have `dataPtr`s, which is fine, but `Base` and `Entity` upstream and `ODELink`, `BulletLink`, etc. downstream will need to use different names for their data pointers.
content.html: Just pointing out that this class is derived from Entity (as is Link), and with each class definition, there is potentially the need for distinct private data pointers with distinct names. These classes have dataPtrs, which is fine, but Base and Entity upstream and ODELink, BulletLink, etc. downstream will need to use different names for their data pointers.
